main event: On June 4, 1966, observers reported seeing a star-like object in the northern sky over Baker, Oregon. The object appeared to hover for approximately 30 minutes and had flashing lights, potentially making it look like an exceptionally bright star.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 30 minutes, Observers noted that the object appeared to hover, Flashing lights were observed from time to time, The object was thought to be an exceptionally bright star due to the hazy conditions, The observers included military personnel and civilians.
sighted object: one star-like object with flashing lights
witness description: military personnel and civilians who reported seeing the object
